questions: Q. 1. Which are two main cropping seasons in India ? Mention their growing and harvesting periods.
answers: Ans. The two main cropping seasons are rabi and kharif.  Rabi crops are sown in winter from October to December and harvested in summer from April to June.  Kharif crops are sown with the onset of monsoon in different parts of the country and harvested in September-October.
